titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Timothy Cole Papers, 1914-1938
titlestmt.author: Inventory prepared by Rachel Schles

publicationstmt.publisher: Archives and Special Collections Library, Vassar College Libraries

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by Jason Kovari, 3 Feb 2009.

did.head: Collection Summary

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Archives and Special Collections Library, Vassar College Libraries

did.abstract: Bookplates and letters to Henry Kimball Prince, ca. 1931-1938; portraits and book illustrations; and 32 prints of a drawing of Vassar College Library.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Born in 1852 in London, Timothy Cole is an American artist and engraver. In 1915, he designed a wood-engraving of the Vassar College Library based on a painting by his son, Alphaeus P. Cole. The engraving commemorated the 50th anniversary of Vassar College. Timothy Cole died in May, 1931 in Poughkeepsie, N.Y.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Bookplates and letters to Henry Kimball Prince, circa 1931-1938; portraits and book illustrations; and 32 prints of a drawing of Vassar College Library.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research according to the regulations of the Vassar College Archives and Special Collections Library without any additional restrictions.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Permission to quote (publish) from unpublished or previously published material must be obtained as described in the regulations of the Vassar College Archives and Special Collections Library.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials

p.archref: The Vassar College Biographical Files contain a biographical file on Timothy Cole, which includes reproductions of correspondence, a published essay on Coleâ€™s bookplates and reproductions of newspaper articles.

relatedmaterial.p: Cole, Alphaeus Philemon, and Margaret Ward Cole. Timothy Cole: wood-engraver. New York: Pioneer Associates, 1935.
Smith, Ralph Clifton. The wood engraved work of Timothy Cole. Washington, D.C.: Priv. Print. [Press of Gibson Brothers, inc.], 1925.

odd.head: Encoding Information
odd.p: Finding aid encoded by Jason Kovari, 3 Feb 2009. Updated by Emma Gronbeck, October 2025.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Finding aid created by Rachel Schles, 8 Jan 2007.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquisition information relating to the Kimball materials in box 1 is currently unknown. Other correspondence in box 1 was removed from the Autograph Files in June 2009. In 2012, the sonnet typescripts were removed from the Rare Book Collection, where they were cataloged with other Dewey materials. The materials in boxes 2 and 3 were presumably transferred to Special Collections from the Main Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Timothy Cole Papers, Archives and Special Collections Library, Vassar College Libraries.
